item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
I do the following for about 6 or 7 databases that I backup and restore between 2 servers every night. These are small databases (less than 40 GB). I also just do a full backup and don’t need differential, I do like all the options you have in your SSIS package, I have to check it out

it is a 3 step SQLAgent job

–Step 1, this will backup the DB to the server I want it restored to

exec OrigServer.MyDataBase.dbo.prBackupMyDataBase

–step 2 restore DB and fix permissions

USE master<br />
GO<br />
ALTER DATABASE MyDataBase SET SINGLE_USER WITH ROLLBACK IMMEDIATE<br />
GO<br />
RESTORE DATABASE MyDataBase FROM  DISK = N'D:MyDataBase.BAK' WITH  FILE = 1,  <br />
NOUNLOAD,  REPLACE,  STATS = 1<br />
GO<br />
ALTER DATABASE MyDataBase SET MULTI_USER<br />
GO<br />
Use MyDataBase<br />
GO<br />
EXECUTE sp_change_users_login 'Update_One', 'SomeName', 'SomeName'<br />

–Step 3 is a Operating System command

del d:MyDataBase.BAK

And that is it
